bibl.title: Alfred Woods v. John H. McGraw. Affidavit of doctor
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the District Court holding terms at Seattle.
In re application of Alfred Woods for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Territory of Washington County of King

J.S.M. Smart being duly sworn on oath deposes and says that for the last ten years he has been and is now a practicing physician. That for nearly one year last past he has been and is now the County Jail physician duly employed by the County Commissioner of said King County, and now since August of this year he has been City health officer of siad city of Seattle.
That he is acquainted with the said Alfred Woods and that said Woods has been and is now under the medical care of this affiant.

That said Woods is now suffering from valvular disease of the heart and consequent inlargement of the same from chronic bronchitis and general debility. That the further confinement of said Woods will tend to aggravate the chronic bronchitis and thereby increase the danger of said Woods dying suddenly from the heart trouble. and that the location of said Woods is such and to aggravate all his symptoms and hasten the disease, the furhter confinement of said Woods in said jail, where the atmosphere and surroundings are cold and damp will greatly impair his nervous condition which will aggravate the said disease. That good hygene surroundings are made essential to his recovery than medicine, and that he cannot recover if kept in confinement.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27th day of October 1885. Maurice McMicken Notary Public
In re application of Alfred Woods for writ of habeas corpus
FILED OCT 28 1885 James Seavey, Clerk. By _____ Deputy Clerk.
